QuestionStem: What advantage does the white-faced marmoset gain by its mode of reproduction?

options.AnswerText: A. The marmoset population has genetic variation.
B. The marmoset can reproduce without a mate.
C. The marmoset can produce many offspring at a time.
options.Feedback: Marmosets usually give birth to twins.

options.AnswerText: D. The marmoset can reproduce by budding.
options.Feedback: Do you think a new marmoset can grow from a piece of the parent marmoset?

FinalIncorrectFeedback: Organisms that reproduce sexually have the advantage of genetic variation in their offspring, which gives the offspring a better chance of surviving changes in their environment.
